intro: Alsine burnatii, commonly known as the Balkan sandwort, is a small annual herb belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to the Balkan Peninsula and thrives in dry, sandy or rocky soils. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-20 centimeters, with slender, branching stems. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and arranged in clusters at the tips of the branches. Alsine burnatii is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in open, disturbed habitats.
